elements.desc:
`gold-cc-cvc-input` is a single-line text field with Material Design styling
for entering a credit card's CVC (Card Verification Code). It supports both
4-digit Amex CVCs and non-Amex 3-digit CVCs

    <gold-cc-cvc-input></gold-cc-cvc-input>

    <gold-cc-cvc-input card-type="amex"></gold-cc-cvc-input>

It may include an optional label, which by default is "CVC".

    <gold-cc-cvc-input label="Card Verification Value"></gold-cc-cvc-input>

It can be used together with a `gold-cc-input` by binding the `cardType` property:

    <gold-cc-input card-type="{{cardType}}"></gold-cc-input>
    <gold-cc-cvc-input card-type="[[cardType]]"></gold-cc-cvc-input>

### Validation

The input considers a valid amex CVC to be 4 digits long, and 3 digits otherwise.
The `amex` attribute can also be bound to a `gold-cc-input`'s `card-type` attribute.

The input can be automatically validated as the user is typing by using
the `auto-validate` and `required` attributes. For manual validation, the
element also has a `validate()` method, which returns the validity of the
input as well sets any appropriate error messages and styles.

See `Polymer.PaperInputBehavior` for more API docs.

### Styling

See `Polymer.PaperInputContainer` for a list of custom properties used to
style this element.

properties.name: allowedPattern
properties.desc:
Set this to specify the pattern allowed by `preventInvalidInput`. Bind this to the
`<input is="iron-input">`'s `allowedPattern` property.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.desc:
Set to true to always float the label. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`alwaysFloatLabel` property.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocapitalize` property.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocomplete` property.

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocorrect` property.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autofocus` property.

properties.name: autosave
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autosave` property, used with type=search.

properties.name: autoValidate
properties.desc:
Set to true to auto-validate the input value. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`autoValidate` property.

properties.name: cardType
properties.desc: The type of card that the CVC is for.

properties.name: charCounter
properties.desc: Set to true to show a character counter.

properties.name: disabled
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable this input. Bind this to both the `<paper-input-container>`'s
and the input's `disabled` property.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.desc:
The error message to display when the input is invalid. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-error>`'s content, if using.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: inputElement
properties.desc: Returns a reference to the input element.

properties.name: inputmode
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `inputmode` property.

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc:
Returns true if the value is invalid. Bind this to both the `<paper-input-container>`'s
and the input's `invalid` property.

properties.name: label
properties.desc: The label for this input.

properties.name: list
properties.desc:
The datalist of the input (if any). This should match the id of an existing <datalist>. Bind this
to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `list` property.

properties.name: max
properties.desc:
The maximum (numeric or date-time) input value.
Can be a String (e.g. `"2000-1-1"`) or a Number (e.g. `2`).
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `max` property.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.desc:
The maximum length of the input value. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s
`maxlength` property.

properties.name: min
properties.desc:
The minimum (numeric or date-time) input value.
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `min` property.

properties.name: minlength
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `minlength` property.

properties.name: name
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `name` property.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable the floating label. Bind this to the `<paper-input-container>`'s
`noLabelFloat` property.

properties.name: pattern
properties.desc:
A pattern to validate the `input` with. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s
`pattern` property.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.desc: A placeholder string in addition to the label. If this is set, the label will always float.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.desc:
Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input. Bind this to the
`<input is="iron-input">`'s `preventInvalidInput` property.

properties.name: readonly
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `readonly` property.

properties.name: required
properties.desc:
Set to true to mark the input as required. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s
`required` property.

properties.name: results
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `results` property, , used with type=search.

properties.name: size
properties.desc: Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `size` property.

properties.name: step
properties.desc:
Limits the numeric or date-time increments.
Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `step` property.

properties.name: type
properties.desc:
The type of the input. The supported types are `text`, `number` and `password`. Bind this
to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `type` property.

properties.name: updateValueAndPreserveCaret
properties.desc: Restores the cursor to its original position after updating the value.

params.name: newValue
params.desc: The value that should be saved.

properties.name: validate
properties.desc:
Returns true if the element has a valid value, and sets the visual
error state.

return.desc: Whether the input is currently valid or not.

properties.name: validator
properties.desc:
Name of the validator to use. Bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `validator`
property.

properties.name: _handleAutoValidate
properties.desc: If `autoValidate` is true, then validates the element.

properties.name: _onFocusedChanged
properties.desc: Overidden from Polymer.IronControlState.

properties.name: _onValueChanged
properties.desc: A handler that is called on input

properties.name: _parentForm
properties.desc: The form that the element is registered to.
